intro: Melanium hirtum, commonly known as the hairy melanium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and covered with fine pubescence. Melanium hirtum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
